page.title: 09TREES IN WOODFORD (1)
page.content: Our survey was taken over 4 sq km in and around the valley of the{River {Avon.}In the valley itself willows, ashes and sycamore, with scattered hawthorns and elders, are most common, although a stretch beside the river (130354) has been planted with poplars to drain a marshy area. There is a surprising regrowth of{elm}(to about 4m), although there is evidence of new beetle activity. On the valley sides and on the downs{beeches}become dominant, interspersed with holly, yew, sycamore and ash. Oaks are almost entirely beside roads. Overall,{ash and{sycamore}are most common. The results of the tree count is shown on page 10.
